messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Animal Vacs
messages.msgSnippet: ... I recently spoke with a person regarding this very subject. Apparently, they have tested many, but not all, brands of vacs for animals, for some reason
messages.messageBody:
>we are havung a very difficult time finding one who will. . . so far,
>probablu 25 or so have said no, and we will not vacinnate, well, its Lelias
>dog and she will not. seems there are even fewer homeopathic vets than
>homeopathic people doctors.
>
>love,ary

I recently spoke with a person regarding this very subject. Apparently,
they have tested many, but not all, brands of vacs for animals, for some
reason they are more 'pure', with less additives than the human ones.
(sans thirmasol and other ingredients that slip my mind right now)

So I asked what they thought about them. The answer was to get the rabies
shot. That was important. But don't bother with the others, such as the
leukemias etc. They don't work.

Just relaying info.. take what you want from it.

kolleen
